meanings.definition: The state or quality of being achy.
meanings.sent1: After a long day of hiking, the achiness in my legs was unbearable.
meanings.sent2: She complained about the achiness in her back after sitting at her desk for hours.
meanings.sent3: The achiness in his muscles made him feel like an old man, even though he was only twenty.
meanings.sent4: The achiness in her heart was a constant reminder of the loss she had experienced.
meanings.sent5: The achiness in her joints felt like tiny elves were tap-dancing on them.

meanings.definition: The sensation of dull pain or discomfort in the body.
meanings.sent1: The achiness in her shoulders was a result of carrying heavy bags all day.
meanings.sent2: He rubbed his temples to ease the achiness caused by staring at the computer screen for too long.
meanings.sent3: The achiness in her feet made her walk like a penguin, much to the amusement of her friends.
meanings.sent4: The achiness in his bones was a sign of the changing weather according to his grandmother.
meanings.sent5: The achiness in her muscles felt like a constant reminder of the intense workout she had done.
